metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0210 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A bug affects the Linux kernelâ€™s ksmbd NTLMv2 authentication and is knownto crash the OS immediately in Linux-based systems.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0210` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-69-generic - 5.15.0-69.76
linux-image-5.15.0-69-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-69.76
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-generic - 5.15.0-69.76
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-generic-64k - 5.15.0-69.76
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1030-kvm - 5.15.0-1030.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1033-aws - 5.15.0-1033.37
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1035-azure - 5.15.0-1035.42
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1031-gcp - 5.15.0-1031.38
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-69-lowlatency - 5.15.0-69.76

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1026-raspi - 5.15.0-1026.28

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1007-oem - 6.1.0-1007.7

linux-image-5.19.0-42-generic - 5.19.0-42.43~22.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-69.76').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1030.35').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1033.37').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1035.42').

linux-oem-5.17: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-oem-6.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1026.28').
linux-oem-6.1 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-1007.7').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-42.43~22.04.1').
linux-lowlatency-hwe-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1024.25~22.04.1').
